channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Communal walkway lights not working, 4th October
item.description:
All lights on communal balcony as well as front door lights are not working, leaving the walkway in pitch darkness. Please rectify.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beaconsfield Road, Walworth, London

item.title: Overflowing Bins, 4th October
item.description:
Property is constantly creating mess on the street, the land lord needs to provide more bins or at least a bin store. Foxes then get in the bins and create chaos for the rest of the street which attracts vermin. Happens every other week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kashgar Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Car, Possibly someone living in it?, 4th October
item.description:
A Van which is clearly been written off in a crash as been abandoned on the road for a good month or more. Another issue is people are in it at night time only which suggests someone might be rough sleeping in it? Either way it needs to be removed by the owner

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead High Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass in playground, 4th October

item.title: Manor Road potholes and deep cracks, 4th October
item.description:
On Manor Rd between Bethune Rd and Listria Park the road surface is now dangerous for cyclists, and is so bumpy it must be damaging the busses and cars that use it. The vibrations from lorries and busses is damaging houses on the street. Please resurface!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rat found dead in a garden in Chessington Avenue, 4th October
item.description:
Rat found dead in a garden in Chessington Avenue. It’s been removed but I wanted to make the council aware of it, as this is the 3rd incident of a rat found dead in a garden in Chessington Avenue in the last week or so.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chessington Avenue, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped moped, 4th October
item.description:
Looks like it was set on fire so I can't tell the make and no numberplate. If you enter the woods via the Crofton Road entrance, take the main dirt path though the woods, Just after you cross the wooden pedestrian bridge over the stream take the left path and its along there. Its been there a few weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drayton Avenue, Locksbottom, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping and misuse of shed for littering, 4th October
item.description:
Shed has been full of general waste for over a year now while its purpose is storage for estate cleaners. Flytipping right outside of the building with bulky waste.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Weymouth Terrace, Hackney, London
